feats.name: Weapon Finesse
feats.notes: With a light weapon, elven curve blade, rapier, whip, or spiked chain made for a creature of your size category, you may use your Dexterity modifier instead of your Strength modifier on attack rolls. If you carry a shield, its armor check penalty applies to your attack rolls.

feats.name: Extra Investigator Talents
feats.notes: You gain one additional investigator talent. You must meet the prerequisites for this investigator talent.

feats.name: Additional traits
feats.notes: Benefit: You gain two character traits of your choice. These traits must be chosen from different lists, and cannot be chosen from lists from which you have already selected a character trait. You must meet any additional qualifications for the character traits you choose — this feat cannot enable you to select a dwarf character trait if you are an elf, for example.

feats.name: Fencing Grace
feats.notes:
Benefit(s): When wielding a rapier one-handed, you can add your Dexterity modifier instead of your Strength modifier to that weapon’s damage. The rapier must be one appropriate for your size. You do not gain this benefit while fighting with two weapons or using flurry of blows, or anytime another hand is otherwise occupied.

In addition, if you have the panache class feature, you gain a +2 bonus to your CMD against attempts to disarm you of your rapier while you have at least 1 panache point.

specialAbilities.name: Unconventional Inspiration
specialAbilities.notes: An investigator with this talent can pick any one skill. He can add his inspiration die to checks attempted with that skill without expending a use of inspiration.
Use inspiration on trained Diplomacy, Heal, Perception, Profession, and Sense Motive without expending inspiration
specialAbilities.name: Expanded Inspiration
Inspired Intelligence
specialAbilities.notes: Add inspiration die to Knowledge, Linguistics, or Spellcraft checks without expending a use of inspiration

specialAbilities.name: Combat Inspiration
specialAbilities.notes: Inspiration on attack rolls and saving throws expends one use instead of two

traits.notes:
Category Basic (Magic)
You have shown a significant talent for the magical arts, gaining the attention of the famed Acadamae of Korvosa. Whenever you succeed at a Knowledge (planes) check to identify a creature and its special powers or vulnerabilities, you gain one additional piece of useful information (as if your skill check result had been 5 higher).

Growing up in a poor neighborhood or in the unforgiving wilds often forced you to subsist on food and water from doubtful sources. You’ve built up your constitution as a result.

Benefit: You gain a +1 trait bonus on Fortitude saves.
